content.certification: Hashicorp Certified - Terraform Authoring and Operations Professional

description-bullets.bullet: Led the architectural separation of a shared enterprise cloud platform into three independently governed environments during a corporate divestment, defining IAM boundaries, network isolation, data ownership, and migration sequencing to eliminate cross-entity blast radius while maintaining zero downtime.

Designed and delivered the organization’s first external-facing API platform using Amazon API Gateway, establishing secure patterns for authentication, authorization, rate limiting, and customer integration at scale.

Defined a standardized platform requirements and intake framework, transforming ad-hoc infrastructure requests into a predictable, auditable delivery model aligned with security and compliance controls.

Founded and led an internal cloud platform enablement program to scale platform knowledge across engineering teams, reducing reliance on the platform team and accelerating adoption of standardized cloud patterns.
Established a technical leadership program within the platform organization to formalize mentorship, architectural review, and knowledge sharing, improving delivery consistency across initiatives.

Redefined the organization’s privileged access model by eliminating standing credentials across AWS environments, designing a short-lived, identity-aware access architecture using Teleport that materially reduced lateral movement risk and improved audit posture.

Designed a standardized infrastructure delivery platform using Terraform, CI/CD pipelines, and policy-as-code (Checkov), enabling teams to self-service compliant infrastructure while preventing non-conformant deployments by default.
Led the architectural decision and execution to migrate critical infrastructure and workloads from Azure to AWS, balancing cost, reliability, security posture, and operational maturity.
Integrated automated tag validation and governance into CI/CD pipelines to enforce CMDB standards, significantly improving cloud cost attribution, chargeback accuracy, and financial visibility.

Architected and managed a multi-region Azure environment for a 5,000+ employee enterprise using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) with Terraform to eliminate configuration drift and establish repeatable deployment patterns.
Defined and enforced CIS and SOX-aligned security controls across hybrid environments, improving audit readiness and reducing compliance risk.
Designed enterprise monitoring and alerting strategies to improve reliability and reduce mean time to detection for critical services.
Owned complex identity and collaboration infrastructure including Active Directory, Office 365, Exchange Online, and Teams.
Standardized endpoint configurations and deployment pipelines across 6,000+ devices using SCCM, reducing incident rates and improving security posture.
Led migration from MDT to SCCM for operating system deployments, simplifying management workflows and eliminating redundant infrastructure.
Contributed to the design and operation of the corporate Citrix environment supporting enterprise virtualization needs.
Implemented and maintained Windows Deployment Services to replace legacy PC build processes, achieving a 50 percent reduction in build times for the university community.
Led the implementation of a Dell KACE environment to centralize software updates, service desk operations, and asset management across multiple departments.
Architected and implemented a modernized Pharos Print Management system that significantly reduced administrative and billing costs while improving the student end-user experience.
Leveraged ITIL best practices to manage high-volume incident resolution, consistently restoring critical services within defined SLA guidelines for faculty, staff, and students.

objective.content: Technical leader with fifteen years of experience designing, securing, and scaling enterprise cloud platforms. Specialized in multi-tenant cloud architecture, security-by-default infrastructure, and platform enablement for large engineering organizations. Expert-level proficiency in AWS, Microsoft Azure, and Infrastructure as Code. Proven record of leading high-ambiguity initiatives, defining long-term technical direction, and creating force-multipliers to enable engineering organizations.

skills.item: AWS (EKS, EC2, VPC, S3, API Gateway)

description-bullets.bullet: Orchestrated the comprehensive communication strategy for Tekko: a large-scale regional event generating an annual economic impact exceeding 5 million dollars.
Developed and expanded the 'Show Your Badge' partnership framework: resulting in measurable increases in event revenue and strengthening strategic ties with local Pittsburgh businesses.
Directed multi-channel brand engagement and industry outreach initiatives to expand attendee reach and maintain a high-visibility presence within the regional cultural sector.
